runs.comm: start round the wicket, length ball on off stump, gets forward and pushed to cover
looped up on middle and leg, clipped round the front pad through midwicket for a single to get off the mark
first sign of turn as Nicol pushes loosely at a wide delivery, which gripped and spun past the outside edge
straighter line, on the stumps, worked towards mid-on for one
flighted on middle and off, Guptill skips out and punches forcefully between the bowler and mid-on for the first boundary

missed run-out chance! Guptill skewed a drive towards cover-point and went charging down the crease, the ball went straight to Jos Buttler but he chose to throw to the bowler's end, where Rob Nicol was safely back
length ball on the stumps, Nicol gets a thin edge on a leg glance, which then comes off the pad towards backward square as Finn appeals for lbw
on a length outside off, pushed towards point

pitched up and Guptill gets his feet in a tangle - that's out, lbw! Finn went full, fast and bang on off, the batsman took a half-step across and then couldn't get his bat down, banging into his boot as the ball struck pad
fierce lifter in the corridor outside off and this has McCullum hopping around the crease, the ball searing past the outside edge
slides this one down the leg side
short of a length again and seaming away a touch, again beats McCullum outside off
length delivery, opens the face and squirts a drive down to third man
tossed up on middle and blocked back to the bowler
length ball, sliding on towards leg stump, defended into the off side
full and flighted, pushed wide of point and they scamper through for one
flighted on middle and off, worked through midwicket
tossed up on middle, McCullum backs away and lasers the ball back past the bowler for a driven four, beaten Wright's dive at long-off
four more, clubbed down the ground! Briggs went full, on the stumps and McCullum flexed those biceps to bunt the ball aerially to long-on, one bounce and over the rope
touch short of a length, defended in front of the stumps
another fierce lifter from Finn, cuts Nicol in half and then nearly hits Kieswetter on the nose, he can only glove it towards short fine leg and they get a bye
banged in short as McCullum gives him the charge, swipes across the line but is beaten

and gone, sliced high to third man! McCullum has been snuffed out by Finn, the batsman took him on, couldn't control the shot and it soared high off the edge to Wright, who took a comfortable low catch. Went for the hurry-up but only hastened his demise
good length ball, sliding towards leg, Nicol misses with a flick but there's a tickle of pad and it race to fine leg
short and outside the line of off, goes across and worked behind square on the leg side
length ball around the line of off, Williamson watchfully pushed back to the bowler
pitched up and pushed to mid-on coming forward
back of a length outside off, Nicol chops through a gap at cover
short and angled in towards the ribs, tucked into the leg side for a single
banged in, tight line, pushed to mid-on but the fielding is quick and that's another dot
short and straying too far to leg, Nicol swings and misses but wide is called anyway
full and drifting towards leg stump, clipped straight to the man on the edge of the circle
back of a length and coming back in at the batsman, turned short on the leg side
short ball outside the line of off, Williamson blocks short on the off side from deep in the crease
touch fuller, in the corridor and tailing in, Williamson tries to drive but mistimes the ball back to the bowler - another dot
short and straight, at the man but the man backs away and smartly cuts through gully for a well-timed four
short ball pulled through square leg for one
pitched up on the stumps, Nicol is ready for this one and carves a flat four back past mid-on, cracking hit
flighted on off, turned through the leg side to the fielder in the deep
tossed up, Nicol leaves the crease and punches one to long-on
flighted, dipping towards middle and leg as Williamson dances out and taps through midwicket
drags this a touch shorter, chopped back into the ground and mid-on prevents one

Nicol goes for the six-hit to deep square leg that served him so well against Sri Lanka ... but this time he picks out the man on the fence! This pitch is a touch slower, the ball came off the toe of the bat rather than the meat and sailed to deep square, who set himself a few yards in from the boundary
tossed up outside off and spinning in, defended
pitched up, slightly full, on middle and leg, Taylor prods it back down the pitch
length delivery on the stumps, worked through square leg with a turn of the wrists
dug in outside the line of off, Williamson mistimes a pull shot
pitched on a good length in the corridor, opens the face for one to third man
bumper, well-directed around the line of off, Taylor can only drop it short on to the wicket and Broad fields
moves across and works a length ball behind square, it's into a gap and they come back for two
big offbreak from Swann, kicking and spitting at Williamson off the surface, the batsman manages to chop it back down on to the pitch
more turn, this one ripping back from outside off and taking the inside edge, missing the wicket and running to short fine leg
tossed up on the stumps, nudged short on the leg side
full and flighted, on middle and off, Williamson comes out and jams it back down the pitch
length ball, spinning towards leg stump, Williamson nearly misses with a clip to leg but just manages to tickle it fine
floated up on the stumps and worked through midwicket on the full
short ball and Taylor clatters a pull shot in front of deep midwicket for the first boundary since the sixth over
another bumper, slightly further outside off, tapped towards point and fielded
slides too far down the leg side
short of a length, Taylor gives himself room but steers his shot straight to point
full and straight and whipped off the pads to deep square leg
bounced ... and called wide on height
another throat-botherer, Williamson sees it early but his hook comes off the splice and loops through square leg
pitched up and driven to mid-off on the front foot
worked from off stump into the leg side
tossed up outside off, misfield at cover from Bresnan allows New Zealand a bonus single
touch shorter and Williamson steps back in his crease to cut through the off side
flatter and quicker on off stump, Taylor tucks it backward of square on the leg side
lack of pace causing problems for the batsman as Williamson tries to pull this and ends up flat-batting it down to long on
ooh, another missed run out? Was tucked into the leg side and there was hesitation, but Morgan produced a poor throw to Kieswetter. Taylor would have been short
round the wicket, full on off stump, worked into the midwicket area
short and cut away out to deep cover
full on middle and leg, tucked in front of square through the leg side
edged! Touch short from Briggs, Williamson eyed the chance to cut, but the ball skidded through and took the top edge
stays round the wicket to the left hander, outside off stump and Franklin works down to long on
nicely bowled, tight on off stump, Taylor defends back to the bowler...very neat over from Briggs
round the wicket, on middle, hint of turn and driven to cover
starts wider outside off and comes in with the arm, pushed into the off side
little quicker this time, no width on offer for Franklin, it's dabbed into the covers for a sharp single
gets this one away, Taylor brings out the sweep to quite a short delivery and sends it backward of square on the leg side
full outside off, squeezed to backward point
nudged from off stump into the leg side
short of a length, Franklin opens the face to guide it backward point and that's nicely placed wide of third man
bouncer over leg stump, loops off the surface and the batsman wanted a wide but the umpire lets it go
uses his feet to a full ball around off stump and drills it firmly towards mid-off who is inside the cricle
back of a length on off stump, drops it square into the off side to rotate the strike again
touch short outside off, a slower ball, Franklin cracks it out to deep cover
good yorker to finish the over, Taylor can only dig it out to the leg side
round the wicket, on leg stump, worked straight to midwicket
releases some of the pressure, played the percentages as he picked this up over midwicket...was a good, clean, swing of the bat
flatter on the leg stump, flicked firmly into the deep and Buttler can't stop the second
goes much fuller, right at Franklin's toes, and he works it square through the leg side and Buttler, again, can't stop the second

tough chance, perhaps that's harsh because Franklin comes down the pitch and crunches this back in Briggs' direction and it was more self preservation than an attempt to catch it as it whistles to the boundary
and that's another brace to end the over as he works through the leg side...much better over for New Zealand and very smartly played by Franklin
on a length outside off, Taylor opens the face down to third man
a slower short ball deceives Franklin as he gives himself room and the ball loops over the top edge
that's a lovely shot, short of a length again and deflects it down to third man...Finn makes a good effort to stop the boundary, gets a hand to it, but can't flick it back
beaten again by a short ball as he tries to hoick it through the leg side...hmm, might have been a wide
big full toss, poor delivery, and it gets dispatched as he swings it backward of square and beats long leg
full and wide outside off, certainly better than leg side, and it's driven out to deep cover
full outside leg stump, Franklin backs away and clubs down to long on
a third for Finn. He's perhaps a touch fortunate because it was short outside off and Taylor picked out his favourite area towards deep midwicket but couldn't clear the man on the boundary
full outside off, a slightly slower ball, and it's dabbed towards point
comes across his stumps to try and work to leg, doesn't make contact and the ball bobbles to the leg side
back of a length, takes Franklin's leg and lobs to the off side so a four effectively becomes a leg bye
finishes with a bouncer, flies over McCullum's head as he ducks
short on leg stump, pulled away to long leg
very full at off stump, driven down the ground to long on
excellent delivery, pinpoint yorker on leg stump, Franklin tried to give himself room but can only push it down the ground
full outside off stump, flicked away firmly by McCullum and Broad makes a good save at midwicket
he's connected with that, another short ball on leg stump and Franklin hooks it with a little bit of top edge and it flies into the crowd
now he paddles, or scoops, him straight over the wicketkeeper. It was a low full toss and he got right underneath it. Excellent batting
gives himself a little room and cuts to backward point
well done by Broad, he followed the batsman as he moved outside leg and it struck the pads
superb shot by McCullum, it's a full ball and he shuffled to leg then lofted it inside-out over cover, striking the boundary marker on the full so that counts as a six
it's a no-ball, very careless from Broad, and McCullum opens the face to backward point
swing and a misses outside off so it doesn't prove too costly for England
gives himself room again, Broad fires it full outside off and that's well bowled as it's well inside the wide markers
fantastic over for New Zealand, poor stuff from Broad as he drops short again and it gets pulled over long leg...so the seventh ball of the over was very costly. Not Broad's best day
full at middle and leg, flicked through midwicket and despite a flat throw by Bairstow from the deep Franklin makes it with a dive
another good yorker, dug out square through the off side
beaten by a full ball outside off and they steal a bye to the keeper...Kieswetter needs to work on his skittles skils
misses his swing to leg and Franklin can't believe that isn't a wide. Think he has a point.
low full toss, paddled into the leg side to bring up a superb half century off 33 balls and he's run out coming back for a second. Didn't bring out the dive this time.
full at off stump, driven down to long-off, and Kieswetter misses the return from the deep reach means they make the second. Sloppy from the keeper.
